other_tests.findings: The pancreas is enlarged in size compared to the previous study, peripancreatic fluid is seen, and elevated serum lipase indicates pancreatitis. Layers of stones are seen in the gallbladder with mild central intrahepatic biliary dilatation. Common bile duct is dilated with high density possibly representing intraluminal sludge/stone or lesion.
other_tests.changes_over_time: The pancreas is enlarged in size compared to the previous study without discrete pancreatic mass seen.
